item.title: Great big gaping hole, 1st October
item.description:
Some 4 weeks ago the council in their wisdom came to repair a pothole… they dug the hole quite nicely informed us it would be repaired the following day 4 weeks later we have a great big hole in the middle of the road with barriers round! We can just about get a car past my nan is disabled and this is causing a massive obstruction
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Rosecroft Close, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover rocking noisily and the tarmac around it sinking., 1st October
item.description:
Noisy manhole reported before ( told it was a Thames Water problem but TW have been and investigated and confirmed it is not theirs but a local council issue ). Tarmac around cover is now sinking and breaking up. As well as the constant noise as traffic drives over it, there is now the concern of collapse and possible accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Empty smart whip containers and broken chair, 1st October
item.description:
Empty drugs smart whip containers on the floor right next to the parks entrance. Old computer chair has also been dumped. The rubbish is mounting on both sides of the street and now starting to cover and block the drains.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Luxmore Street, New Cross, London

item.title: Racist graffiti on mural in Erith station underpass, 1st October
item.description:
There is graffiti in big red letters stating “send them back” over the mural on the wall of the underpass on the road that leads to Erith station. It has damaged the mural and is incredibly offensive.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronze Age Way, Northumberland Heath, London

item.description:

item.title: Footpath and No Cycling signs missing, 1st October
item.description:
The signs for the unmade footpath parallel to Cromwell Avenue fell down years ago and have never been replaced. Young people on bikes are using the footpath as an offroad bmx type cycle track and have been digging it up to make ramps and bumps. When challenged they say they are allowed to do this and it doesn't say anywhere it's a footpath and the no cycling sign is no longer there. Please arrange for these signs to be replaced so these children are clear that they can not cycle here as it is a footpath. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Close, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress with drugs and rubbish thrown in front of the bin chute in St Vincent House in Fendall street, 1st October
item.description:
Mattress with drugs and rubbish thrown in front of the bin chute in St Vincent House in Fendall street. This issue has been going on fo almost a month. please do not close ticket if action is not taken. Issue still there.it has come to my attention that you close tickets without solving the issue. Council officer is aware.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fendall Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
